Dating: BYZANTINE PERIOD (not before); COPTIC PERIOD ?; COPTIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Phial
Description: This phial of terracotta, whose provenance is not known, is distinguished by a very long neck equipped with a handle. The motif which is repeated on the two faces is too effaced to recognise all the details. Could it be the famous representation of Saint Menas accompanied by two camels or is it another saint who decorates the belly of this phial?
